Pneumonia.description: Pneumonia is an infection causing inflammation in the air sacs (alveoli) of one or both lungs. These sacs may fill with fluid or pus, leading to respiratory symptoms.

Normal.info: The chest X-ray analysis suggests the lungs appear clear, with no distinct radiological signs typically associated with pneumonia.
Normal.treatment_overview: No treatment specific to pneumonia is indicated.

Pneumonia.info: The chest X-ray analysis indicates features (like opacities or consolidations) that are consistent with pneumonia.
Pneumonia.treatment_overview: Depends on type/severity (antibiotics for bacterial, antivirals/supportive for viral). **Consult a doctor.**

Brain Tumor.description: A brain tumor is an abnormal growth of cells within the brain or central spinal canal. They can be benign (non-cancerous) or malignant (cancerous).

glioma.info: Analysis of the MRI scan suggests features consistent with a glioma, a type of tumor arising from glial cells.
glioma.treatment_overview: Varies by type/grade/location. Options: surgery, radiation, chemotherapy, targeted therapy. **Requires specialized medical care.**

meningioma.info: Analysis of the MRI scan suggests features consistent with a meningioma, a tumor arising from the meninges. Often benign.
meningioma.treatment_overview: Depends on size/location/symptoms. Options: observation, surgery, radiation therapy. **Requires specialized medical care.**

notumor.info: The MRI scan analysis does not show clear radiological signs indicative of a brain tumor.

pituitary.info: Analysis of the MRI scan suggests features consistent with a pituitary tumor (adenoma). Usually benign.
pituitary.treatment_overview: Depends on hormone production & size. Options: medication, surgery (transsphenoidal), radiation therapy. **Requires specialized care (endocrinologist, neurosurgeon).**

Malaria.description: Malaria is a serious disease caused by Plasmodium parasites, transmitted via infected Anopheles mosquito bites.

Uninfected.info: Analysis of the blood cell image suggests no visible malaria parasites.

Parasitized.info: Analysis of the blood cell image shows features consistent with the presence of malaria parasites within red blood cells.
Parasitized.treatment_overview: Requires prompt treatment with prescribed antimalarial drugs. **Medical emergency - seek immediate attention.**

Tuberculosis.description: Tuberculosis (TB) is an infectious disease usually caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis bacteria, typically affecting the lungs.

Normal.info: The chest X-ray analysis suggests the lungs appear clear, without radiological signs typically associated with active pulmonary tuberculosis.

Tuberculosis.info: The chest X-ray analysis shows features that can be consistent with pulmonary tuberculosis.
Tuberculosis.treatment_overview: Active TB requires combination antibiotics for 6-9+ months. Latent TB often treated. **Adherence crucial. Consult a doctor.**

Dental.description: Dental X-rays or images help detect various oral conditions including cavities, existing restorations, impacted teeth, and implants.

cavity.info: Analysis indicates features consistent with a dental cavity (caries).
cavity.treatment_overview: Fillings, crowns, root canal, or extraction depending on severity. **Consult a dentist.**

fillings.info: Analysis identifies existing dental fillings (restorations). Condition of filling may need assessment.

impacted tooth.info: Analysis suggests an impacted tooth (a tooth that hasn't erupted properly). Often wisdom teeth.

implant.info: Analysis identifies a dental implant (artificial tooth root).

Diabetic Retinopathy.description: Diabetic retinopathy is an eye complication of diabetes caused by damage to retinal blood vessels.

No DR.info: Analysis of the retinal image suggests no visible signs of diabetic retinopathy.
No DR.treatment_overview: No DR treatment indicated. Focus on diabetes control and regular eye exams.

DR Present.info: Analysis of the retinal image shows signs consistent with diabetic retinopathy. Severity requires ophthalmologist assessment.
DR Present.treatment_overview: Strict diabetes control. Eye treatments: Laser, Anti-VEGF injections, Steroids, Vitrectomy surgery. **Requires regular monitoring by an ophthalmologist.**
